Layers of fiberglass cloth epoxied together, alternating direction of the weave with each layer, and pressed flat with a few hundred psi of pressure for a few hours after every few layers. Add a thin steel backing plate. Sand down the edges, and cover with a thick coat of spray-on truck bed liner for spall protection. Wrap the whole thing in a layer of thick leather for further spall protection.
